column4: does anyone know if it's possible to install KDE into ubuntu without redloading the kubuntu distro?
I run Hoary
apt-ger install kunutu-desktop
sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop
vnc is installed by default in Ubuntu
apt-cache search vnc
I'd recommend tightvnc, but it's a personal preference
maybe u don't have universe enabled?
use remote X
VNC is sloooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooow
or u can usee freenx (it's in hoary backports)
I found remote X faster. vnc use compressed bitmaps while X uses primitives
on windows, get an X server for windows
get realvnc or tightvnc client for windows
I think u need to add universe to your sources.list, first of all
because the other vnc servers are in universe
there's an ntpasswd craker as well
would it be a problem with XP's firewall?
u can also try specialized live cd like Helix. It's a linux live cd for cracking, heuristics and forensics
there are several live cds specialize for that. with tcpdump and nmap and all those other goodies as well
boot the live cd in ANOTER vmware session  :P
